revised_title: Comparative Analysis of Stomatogastric Neuromuscular System in Decapod Crustaceans
tldr: This study examines the structure and anatomy of the stomatogastric neuromuscular system in three different species of decapod crustaceans: Callinectes sapidus, Homarus americanus, and Panulirus argus. The research focuses on the stomach ossicles, muscles, and nervous system, providing a comprehensive classification scheme for identifying homologous muscles and neurons across species. The findings can serve as a basis for consistent identification of stomatogastric motor neurons in the reptantian decapods.
